definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: God is indeed love, but also a just Judge.
sentences.chinese: 神的确是爱，但是同时他也是位公正的审判者。

sentences.english: God is a righteous judge, a God who expresses his wrath every day.
sentences.chinese: 神是公义的审判者，又是天天向恶人发怒的神。

sentences.english: The trial by the end of life is time.
sentences.chinese: 生命最终的审判者是时间。

sentences.english: And judgment shall sit, that his power may be taken away, and be broken in pieces, and perish even to the end.
sentences.chinese: 然后审判者要坐堂，夺去他的统治权，将他永远消灭。

sentences.english: Such jurors functioned as both witnesses and triers of fact.
sentences.chinese: 这种陪审员的功能相当于证人和事实的审判者。

sentences.english: For there is no judge upon earth between the supreme magistrate and the people.
sentences.chinese: 因为在地上，在最高的法官和人们之间没有审判者了。

sentences.english: Yes. Convert all of my Vindicators to Inquisitors.
sentences.chinese: 是的，把我所有的维护者升级为审判者。

sentences.english: They thought that God, while an unforgiving judge, was also a mathematician.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为上帝，毫不宽容的审判者，也是一位数学家。

sentences.english: And you are my toughest critic.
sentences.chinese: 而你是我最严厉的审判者。

definition: Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
